dialogues.text: Human, I admire your persistence. Tell me, why were you seeking the origin of the Aemir?

options.text: I am looking for some missing people.

dialogues.text: My name is Porewit, nature spirit guardian of the Celenor woods. I have been protecting this area against defilers for centuries.
I don't know the 'why'. The river has been polluted by someone intentionally. In order to protect the forest from further damage, I shrouded it in a very dense mist.
Missing people? I am sorry, but I know not what you speak of, human.
I can, but I will not do so until the river has been restored back to its purified state.

options.text: What can I do to help?

dialogues.text: If you wish to help, you should find out who polluted the Aemir and how. Good luck!

options.text: I found out the 'Halogwyr' polluted the Aemir!
The Aemir was polluted with a potion.

dialogues.text: The Halogwyr?! Human, I am shocked. The Halogwyr are an ancient cult of elves, who were banished from the Celenor clan centuries ago.
The Halogwyr were once Celenor elves, but they did not respect our most important rule: To respect and preserve nature, they exhausted the environment for personal gain.
The Halogwyr supposedly studied darker forms of magic, such as Alchemy and Necromancy. For this reason they were exiled.
A potion you say? Given your evidence, I fear they have brewed a Potion of Defilement. This potion was banned centuries ago...
Someone has used very ancient magics to create this. We must do the same and create a potion that will reverse the effects and purify the river.
Please bring me an Amanita mushroom and a sample of the polluted water.

options.text: Where can I find an Amanita mushroom?
I'll get the ingredients for you.

dialogues.text: Amanita mushrooms are rare. I have not left the Riverflank lately, but I recall some growing in Celenor Forest Edge.
